CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function uses the 'innerHTML' property to insert user-controlled data into the DOM. If the user-controlled data is not properly sanitized, an attacker can inject malicious scripts that will be executed when other users view the page. This can lead to a variety of attacks such as stealing sensitive information, performing actions on behalf of the user, or spreading malware.
